EXPERIENCE: A doc diagnosed me with dust mite allergy 6 months ago and it was a slow uphill battle ever since.

Medication: For over the counter medication, Claritin was great. For major attacks, my doctor gave me Zyrtec. He also gave me this ointment, Maxitrol, which helps reduce the swelling since I'd have huge welts on my face from it.
Pillow and mattress casings worked wonders for me. So did changing bedsheets and pillow cases every 5-7 days.

Someone told me that Bounce fabric softener sheets placed inside pillows and bedsheets work. I tried it. It made my bed smell good and I didn't have any attack... although I don't know if it was because of Bounce or not. I didn't notice any change when I used Febreeze either.
INFORMATION: It eliminates 75% of dust mites.
Dust mites hate alcohol or babyoil products.
A plastice cover for the bed will greatly reduce the dust mites at night time(sleeping.)
Zyrtec and Claritin are not as powerful in knocking you out as Benadryl although they still do have a bit of making you a little bit drowsy or dull.
Dust mites love moisture so it's important to keep everything dry.
SUGGESTION: Go buy some Fabree Allergen spray at Food Lion or any store that carries it.
Use germ-x (handcleaner) on your mattress.
Dont use around electric appliances.
Take a bath in olive oil and rash will go away.

get rid of carpets, and all sorts of fabrics around the house, use blinds instead of drapes, dont wear fuzzy sweaters, have your air ducting cleaned, get an electrostatic air cleaner  put on your forced air heat system or a very good air filtration fan with filters you change often, clean like mad, use hypoallergenic mattress and pillow covers and make sure you dont use feather pillows. use leather , vinyl or micro fiber furniture. use any allergy pills like benedryl. have tile or wood floors,
One tip--Buy a new pillow and wash the bed sheets once a week.

summaries.EXPERIENCE: In users’ experiences, individuals report being diagnosed with dust mite allergies, using medications such as Claritin, Zyrtec, and Maxitrol for relief, and achieving improvements through pillow casings, frequent sheet changes, and various home remedies.
summaries.INFORMATION: For information purposes, dust mites thrive in moisture, can be reduced by certain sprays or covers, and over-the-counter medications like Claritin and Zyrtec cause mild drowsiness compared to Benadryl.
summaries.SUGGESTION: Recommended measures include purchasing allergen sprays, eliminating or reducing carpets, using mattress covers, washing sheets weekly, applying germ-x on mattresses, avoiding certain fabrics, and taking allergen medication such as Benadryl.

EXPERIENCE: Using these tools I had my non-nose blowing kids sorted out in just 3 days.
INFORMATION: If it was allergies both sides of your nose would be involved and you would have sneezing and possibly some clear nasal drainage.
The right side represents masculine and the left, feminine.
CAUSE: Stuffy Nose can be a result of not recognizing self worth
SUGGESTION: Louise Hay would suggest that every time you have a negative thought about yourself, you stop and say (out loud or in your mind) I recognize my own self worth and I love and appreciate myself. I, personally, would also recommend essential oil steam treatment - it just worked a treat on my kids.
You can try taking Sudafed to see if this helps.
you may want to get it checked out.
This will sound gross and seem crazy but get a neti pot and use saline to rinse your your sinuses every night when you feel like this.

summaries.EXPERIENCE: In user experience, one individual noted success treating a child’s stuffy nose with essential oil steam and vapor rub over three days.
summaries.INFORMATION: For information purposes, some answers suggest that bilateral nasal blockage with sneezing may indicate allergies, while other philosophical perspectives attribute right and left nasal blockage to masculine or feminine emotional factors.
summaries.CAUSE: One suggestion is that a stuffy nose may be caused by low self-worth or emotional stress.
summaries.SUGGESTION: Recommendations include practicing positive affirmations, trying essential oil steam treatments, using a neti pot, taking Sudafed, and seeking medical evaluation if symptoms persist.

EXPERIENCE: It still occurs every now and then (during allergy season primarily) but not with the frequency it once did.
INFORMATION: Possibly a tonsil infection...
You might have a pocket of some sort that gathers gunk and then it just comes out.
It's been said that it is a build up of plaque (the same that covers your teeth) that accumulates.
SUGGESTION: see a doctor
I'd go to an ear, eye, nose and throat doctor if I were you...
Just keep up with the oral hygiene.

summaries.EXPERIENCE: In user experiences, individuals report noticing similar waxy or plaque-like buildup in their throats, with occasional recurrences tied to allergies.
summaries.INFORMATION: For information purposes, some suggest that these particles may be related to tonsil infections, trapped debris in throat pockets, or accumulations of plaque.
summaries.SUGGESTION: Recommendations include consulting an ear, nose, and throat specialist for evaluation and maintaining good oral hygiene.

EXPERIENCE: I took relpax a few times and each time i got terrible chest pains that shot down my arm and i would fall asleep. once i woke up my headache was gone.

I suffer also.  I don't know if there is a cure but it is a try this and try that situation.  I've suffered since early elementary school.  But I have found that Excedrin for Migraines works really well for me.  When I have a full blown, kick "a" migraine I have to go to my doctor for a shot of demorol. I have a friend who uses imetrex (sp?) and she speaks highly of this medication.
i find sleep is the only thing that works for me, is lying in a dark room with a cool face washer or ice pack on my head.

I also had bad headaches...HAVE YOU HAD AN MRI?  ARNOLD-CHIARI MALFORMATION ONLY SHOWS UP ON MRI- NOT CT.  I was finally diagnosed when I was 25..had surgery, and never get the headaches like that anymore...by the way, my son-8- also has this.
My god, honey. It sounds like more than a migrain. I take Immatrex.
INFORMATION: There are two drugs out there, topamax which you would take every day, and relpax which you would take when you get the migraine. the doctor did mention that a significant side effect is weight loss.
SUGGESTION: For now though, take some advil and drink something with a lot of caffeine in it, preferably coffee and lie down.
Ask your doctor about these and see if they help.
HAVE YOU HAD AN MRI?

summaries.EXPERIENCE: Users share personal experiences with various migraine medications, such as Relpax, Excedrin, Imetrex, and topamax, noting side effects like chest pain, and describing relief through rest, sleep, or surgeries for related conditions.
summaries.INFORMATION: For information purposes, multiple prescription treatments exist (e.g. topamax, relpax) that may alleviate migraines, although they can have notable side effects including chest pain or sedation. Diagnostic imaging like MRI may be needed for underlying causes.
summaries.SUGGESTION: Suggestions include using over-the-counter remedies (Excedrin, Advil, caffeine), discussing prescription options with a doctor, and considering an MRI to rule out other conditions.

INFORMATION: If it can, then it is most likely a candida (yeast) infection. Any condition in which your immune system drops (such as prolonged used of antibiotics, corticosteriods, or immunocompromising diseases like AIDS, chemotherapy, etc.) can predispose you to this infection.
If it is oral candidiasis, also called oral thrush, then antifungal treatment can be prescribed to you by a doctor.
SUGGESTION: you should consult a physician...and gargle
Mate you need to go see a Naturopath or Herbalist
Is it possible that your red spot is from scraping off the white coat? If so, maybe you should see if you have Candidiasis.
First off, you may want to go get this checked out by your doctor.

summaries.INFORMATION: For information purposes, a white tongue patch may indicate a candida (yeast) infection, also called oral thrush, often associated with weakened immune systems.
summaries.SUGGESTION: Recommendations include consulting a physician, or alternative practitioners like a naturopath or herbalist, and considering antifungal treatments if candidiasis is suspected.

SUGGESTION: Call every University affiliated oncology center and find out if she can be entered in a research protocol. These are usually without any charge to the patient. You can even try a google search for keywords such as "enrollment research ovarian cancer trial". One of the trials you should look into can be found at www.assist-ovarian.com

There are clinics and hospitals out there that will help her even if you do not have insurance. They will bill you but you can pay it out however much you can afford ata time, even if its only $5.00 a month as long as you pay them something. Also there may be some kind of assistance throught the state in which you live in that can help her out with the bills!
If shes terminal, she SHOULD be able to get SSI immediately...

summaries.SUGGESTION: Recommendations include contacting university-affiliated oncology centers for research trials, seeking care at clinics that offer payment plans, and exploring government disability or SSI options.

EXPERIENCE: I am a cancer survivor and had no money to pay any of my medical bills, but I got all my treatememts I needed and today I am cancer free.
INFORMATION: There is no really way to know, it would depend on the chemo they type of brain tumor it is and all kinds of other things.
SUGGESTION: He should not worry about paying for treatemtns at this time and get what ever treatements he needs.
He should continue EVEN IF he has no funds.

Has the Dr. tried to contract the company that makes the chemo your boyfriend uses? Quite often if the Dr (or the Dr's staff) is willing to contact the company and say that this person is not able to pay for their treatment the company will offer it at a discounted rate.
look at the testimonials on cancer on my page.

summaries.EXPERIENCE: One cancer survivor reports obtaining needed treatments despite financial hardship and ultimately becoming cancer-free.
summaries.INFORMATION: For information purposes, treatment outcomes can depend on the specific chemotherapy regimen and tumor type.
summaries.SUGGESTION: Suggestions include continuing chemotherapy regardless of cost, seeking assistance or discounts from drug manufacturers, and reviewing additional resources or testimonials.

INFORMATION: Yes I have heard of it. It is a very rare thing, mostly due to the fact that Americans in general have good living conditions.

Trichuiriasis is a human disease caused by a parasitic whipworm called Trichuris trichiura. It is normally characterised by abdominal painand diarrhea The parasote is primarily found in the tropics and sub-tropicswhere the climate is warm and moist.
Wikipedia says that" Trichuriasis is a parasitic disease caused by infection of the large intestine by a parasite whipworm (Trichuris trichiura).... it is common worldwide

Trichuriasis is a parasitic disease caused by infection of the large intestine by a parasite whipworm (Trichuris trichiura). Trichuriasis is common worldwide (in particular among countries with warm, humid climates)
I've heard of it.  It's one of those things you are more likely to see on "House" than in US practice.
Larvae of the pork round worm Trichinella spiralis migrate throughout the body and occassionally to the brain.

summaries.INFORMATION: For information purposes, Trichuriasis is caused by a parasitic whipworm, typically impacting the large intestine. Rarely, infections may spread to the brain, but such cases are extremely uncommon.

EXPERIENCE: I've had my tonsils removed. It wasn't that big of a deal, my weight remained the same as before and the pain was definitely tolerable.
INFORMATION: Taking out your tonsils usually doesn't take too long. It takes about 30 minutes. The tonsils directly don't have anything to do with your weight however when they are big people tend to eat less. So when they are removed they do eat more and can gain weight.
it does not  hurt a lot but it hurts. some people just get there tonsils remove and eat a lot more then they used to all you do is get sick and puke for a day or two.
SUGGESTION: not big deal, remove it, it help you in your sleep and help others to sleep well.

summaries.EXPERIENCE: A user reports having had a tonsillectomy with tolerable pain and no significant weight change.
summaries.INFORMATION: For information purposes, tonsil removal is typically brief (around 30 minutes) and can lead to increased appetite after surgery since large tonsils may have previously impacted eating habits.
summaries.SUGGESTION: It is suggested that removal can improve both the patient's sleep and that of others, though some individuals experience vomiting and pain in the first days post-surgery.

EXPERIENCE: When I had mine done, it took hours before the novocaine wore off, once the novocaine does wear off you should probably take some sort of painkiller. I didn't eat regular food for a week.
I didn't eat regular food for a week. But I was able to make do with yogurt and ice cream and such. Also, make sure you use your saltwater rinse, it has had amazing results.

I was able to eat again that same day and had virtually no pain at all once the surgery was over. Then again, though, I was in so much pain BEFORE the surgery that any pain I felt AFTER the surgery was so mild.
INFORMATION: It took hours before the novocaine wore off when I had mine done. Once the novocaine does wear off, however, you should probably take some sort of painkiller because --trust me-- it will hurt.
You can get a painful swelling called 'dry socket' if you do not follow instructions carefully.
SUGGESTION: Take it easy for at least a week, stick to soft foods, rinse with salt water, and use ice packs for swelling if needed.

summaries.EXPERIENCE: Several users describe varied experiences with wisdom teeth removal, ranging from minimal pain and quick return to normal eating, to needing a week of soft foods and rest.
summaries.INFORMATION: For information purposes, novocaine can last for several hours post-surgery, and painkillers may be necessary once it wears off. Some warn of complications like dry socket if aftercare is not followed properly.
summaries.SUGGESTION: Common recommendations include adhering to soft foods for about a week, performing saltwater rinses, and using ice packs or pain relief as needed to promote healing.
